intro: Peteravenia phoenicolepis, commonly known as the golden beard lily, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive beard-like structure at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
